channel.title: Game Developing
channel.description:
I want to get your opinion.
Should I catch a train every day to TAFE (kinda like university) that takes 2 hours to get there and do a Game Developing course which cost $10,000 and go there 5 days a week for 2 years straight?
Is that worth it just to learn how to professionally code games? or should i just get a shitty job like everyone else and move on from game?

item.title: Game Developing
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

I’m doing a degree in game dev, and yeah you can learn most of it at home its not that hard but its 999999 fun.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Developing
item.dc:creator: @Racist_Turtle Racist Turtle
item.description:
@Racist_Turtle wrote:

If your looking for a degree in game developing or programming, sure go for it (even though it sounds pretty overpriced). Though, a lot of people (including myself) have self-taught ourselves programming (reading books, websites, looking at code, etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: Game Developing
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Davidi2:

Sounds overpriced and underqualified…

This. I’ve always heard / told to never go to a college that specifies in ONE general thing, as they are most likely a non-credited university. In other words, always chose a 4 year degree, mainstream university, over a 2 year specialty university. I have never actually looked into it, to see if that was the case, but it seems logical to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Game Developing
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

you’re not thinking outside of the box.

Read full topic

I want to get your opinion.

Should I catch a train every day to TAFE (kinda like university) that takes 2 hours to get there and do a Game Developing course which cost $10,000 and go there 5 days a week for 2 years straight?

Is that worth it just to learn how to professionally code games? or should i just get a shitty job like everyone else and move on from game?
[/quote]Aren’t you 13?[/quote]

No? I haven’t been 13 for like 3 years now.

item.description:

Andrew Ferguson:

Coding is a big thing now and it’s going to continue to grow for a while,

item.title: Game Developing
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Coding is a big thing now and it’s going to continue to grow for a while, I say its worth it. Best thing to go to collage for now is something related to new sources of energy and computers. That train ride seems a little long though, bring a laptop.

Read full topic
